result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Payment plan granted $50/mo starting 09/01/2022 or one day in jail for every $25.00 then owing, until paid in full.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Judith Matos Santiago

records.addlTxt: DEJ
DEJ Order
Notice of right to seek postconviction relief
DNA Submission Form

11:42 AM ADA calls case and states appearances. Defendant Judith Matos Santiago in court.  Attorney laurence M moon in court for Judith Matos Santiago.  Attorney Mark T. Fuhr in court for State of Wisconsin. ADA Fuhr states an agreement has been reached and recites the agreement on record. Parties agree to the terms of the agreement. DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to all counts. Court questions DE regarding the plea. DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of DEJ in Ct. 1 and JOC in Ct. 2. Comments by parties. Attorney Moon requests a court note be added to this case that states the charge was manufacturing and not delivery due to the charge causing issues with the defendant finding housing/work. So Ordered by the court. 

Ct. 1- DEJ for 1 Year 

Ct. 2- 
$300 Fine 
$200 DNA 
Monetary Obligations: $50/mo starting on or before 09/01/2022 or one day in jail for every $25.00 then owing, until paid in full. 
Defendant is given 7 days of Jail credit 

Appeal Rights Given
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:30 PM DA calls case and states appearances. Defendant Judith Matos Santiago appeared by video.  Attorney laurence M moon appeared by video for Judith Matos Santiago.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Moon gives a status update in the case. Attorney Moon requests another status date. Karl Kelz sets a pretrial conference with Attorney Moon for 08/09/2022 at 2:00 PM
To appear remotely
Request to Appear Remotely

ADDRESS INFO for State of Wisconsin
Current: 2820 W. Mills Rd. Apt. H, Glendale, WI 53209 United States  (Effective: 05-24-2022)
Prior: 2820 W. Mills Rd. Apt. H, Glendale, WI 53209 United States
Current Information
Status hearing on June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Request for Discovery
Scheduled for 04/25/2022 at 3:15 PM

03:31 PM DA calls case and states appearances. Defendant Judith Matos Santiago appeared in person with attorney laurence M moon who appeared by telephone. Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court states an unsigned waiver of preliminary hearing was filed earlier today. Attorney Moon states he went over the waiver with his client over the phone. Court questions defendant and goes over the waiver of preliminary hearing form line item by line item. Preliminary Hearing waived.  Waiver accepted by the Court.   Court finds probable cause exists that a crime was committed and binds DE over for trial.  Information filed, acknowledged by parties and reading waived.  DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts. Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled for 04/25/2022 at 3:15 PM
Waiver of Prelim on March 21, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Scheduled for 02/15/2022 at 2:00 PM

10:07 AM Defendant Judith Matos Santiago appeared in court. Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.   Notice of right to attorney given to DE. Bond to continue.  Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.  If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.
Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.
Demand for discovery and notice of intent to use DNA

2:00 PM DA calls case and states appearances and possible charges. Defendant appeared via video from Price County Jail. Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DE next court date is 01/11/2022 at 10 am.  Jail gives DE a notice of right to attorney.  Court questions parties as to bond.  DA states bond recommendation. Bond Set.
